attributes.action: Intervene in the management of Bishop Auckland General Hospital.
attributes.background: Since Bishop Auckland General Hospital merged in to County Durham & Darlington NHS Trust, services have been lost and ward closures have become the normality. The hospital is now unable to serve the town and area.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must work with NHS Improvement to investigate these failings, and if necessary consider removing the trust’s responsibility for Bishop Auckland General Hospital.

attributes.action: DfE: add a clear definition of Order of Operations to National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Current National Curriculum does not provide information on what Order of Operations should be in maths. Most students and teachers use BODMAS to remember the sequence but, unfortunately, some of them understand the order too literally and therefore are not able to complete simple maths sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of study resources omit ( or do not detail enough) the fact that Division and Multiplication, as well as Addition and Subtraction, are equally ranked and have to be completed left-to-right. Many students, and unfortunately, some teachers, understand the order too literally, calculating Addition before Subtraction getting wrong answers for simple maths sentences. 
We are worried about future of our kids, who will have to pass their exams to get into higher education.

attributes.action: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.background: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.additional_details:
Right to 28 days to repay prescription charges:

Temporary financial difficulties happen to us all at some point in our lives, and being struck by one can be made worse when you become ill but don't qualify for financial support. I would like to propose that there be made available a 28 day period of grace for all citizens to pay prescription charges after the receipt of items. No one should be left without medical care because of a short term financial crisis. 
So those who desperately need medical help can receive it and re-pay within their next pay period.

attributes.action: Make Flu Jab Free For All Parents With Infants Under 6 Months
attributes.background: Babies are the most likely to be admitted to hospital with flu, and are not eligible for vaccine until they are 6 months old. In addition pregnancy causes immunosuppression. In order to reduce the number of babies getting flu, their primary caregivers should be eligible for a free NHS flu vaccine.

attributes.action: Make Makaton/BSL part of the national curriculum at Early Years Level.
attributes.background: Communication is an ESSENTIAL life skill. Much of everyday life relies on it, from playing to learning, to getting our needs met. Makaton is a language programme using signs and symbols to aid communication and designed to support the spoken language.
attributes.additional_details: My son is 5 years old, just started year 1 mainstream primary school and has a diagnosis of non verbal autism with learning difficulties. His needs are not deemed enough for an additional needs school yet he is unable to communicate with his peers and teachers. If makaton or BSL were taught in the early years my son would now be able to communicate his needs, communicate with his friends and show his teachers how much he understands of the curriculum he is being taught. Please help us 10,000 signatures is all we need in order to give him a voice!

attributes.action: Lower the age for smear tests.
attributes.background:
The legal age to be provided a smear test is 25, why is this? Because it seems to be that it is ‘rare’ for women to be diagnosed with cervical cancer under the age of 25, but it happens. 
This is why I want to lower the age to at least 16, seeing as this is the LEGAL age to have sex.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 3,126 cases of cervical cancer in 2015. How many of these women were over 25? We don’t know. 
There were 854 deaths caused by cervical cancer in 2016 alone.
99.8% of cases could of be prevented in 2016, is this because some of the women were under 25 and weren’t provided a smear test?
Being 19 and having issues and worries about my health is scary, to not be provided a smear test for me is upsetting and worrying. Please help me lower the age to 16 at the very least. Help save lives.

attributes.action: Revoke A50 then hold a new referendum with a 55% supermajority requirement
attributes.background: Since the last referendum was advisory and required only a simple majority, the small majority difference has caused immense recriminations. To bring the nation together, Revok Article 50, then have a referendum that requires 55% majority to leave or remain giving a clear 10% decisive difference

attributes.action: Provide domestic violence victims with paid leave to help them escape abusers
attributes.background: An average of 2 women a week are killed in the UK. The majority are killed at home, often at the hands of a partner. One of the most dangerous times for a victim of domestic abuse is when they try to leave. In giving victims help with their economic situation, we could save so many.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside a threat of violence, emotional & financial barriers make leaving an abusive home difficult. Escaping requires meticulous planning and preparation. Someone may need time off work to move without their partner knowing or they may simply not be able to afford to escape. 

If the UK follows the example set by New Zealand and the Philippines, in giving domestic violence victims paid leave to escape their violent household, we could help before it's too late. 

https://www.google.co.nz/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/world/2018/jul/26/new-zealand-paid-domestic-violence-leave-jan-logie

attributes.action: More Necessary Research and Funding on the NHS for Ehlers Danlos Patients.
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos syndrome is a condition that affects the connective tissue. Several of the symptoms involve stretchy skin, severe dislocations and unusual bleeding as well as joint pain. Seven years ago I was diagnosed with Eds which is when I realised that research was limited.
attributes.additional_details: As an EDS sufferer for several years, it has become apparent that the lack of research and funding and treatments not being on the NHS is the reason that Ehlers danlos patients are treated unfairly. If we attend Accident and Emergency we should not have to explain to medical professionals what our condition is and the symptoms they should look out for and we should not have to find our own ways of treatment because the NHS lacks sufficient help.

attributes.action: Make an unlawful killing law for killing pets.
attributes.background: Our 'family pet' was killed without justifiable cause. We have received unsatisfactory help from the 'authorities'. I feel a change in the law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Recently our family pet (dog) was killed by another dog owner who was 'trying to separate' six excited, playing dogs (3 of them his own) with a small branch/large stick laying nearby. He killed our dog Louie with one hit on the head. The R.S.P.C.A. say it wasn't cruelty as Louie died instantly and the police are not pursuing a prosecution. This has caused a lot of distress to the family and a lot of concern locally. A new law or a clearer defining of current laws are urgently needed.

attributes.action: Carers must be included in the key worker scheme
attributes.background: Carers are largest source of care in the UK and should be included in the key workers living scheme. Despite the govt attempts this scheme does not extend far beyond. The fact is that what constitute the term key workers is narrow and the individuals that fall outside this definition are left out.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of affordable housing for carers has not received the attention. It is essential that carers live in all parts of our communities to provide invaluable service to the UK population which is currently experiencing a high number of old people requiring the services of the carers. Financial challenges due to Poor wages, high cost of accommodation especially in more affluent areas makes it difficult to attract and retain carers. I suggest the carers are included to the key worker scheme to support them and ensure that they provide safe and excellent services, and also make them appreciated by their govt

attributes.action: Stop tax on vet bills
attributes.background: A recent visit to the vets saw my dog have to undergo emergency surgery at the cost, all told, of just over £1200.00. When paying the bill I was appalled to see nearly £180.00 in tax!! Being taxed on your pets welfare is extremely wrong in my eyes.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student and a carer and survive on a small income. Although I was insured, due to the health background history of the pet, they would not pay. I was fortunate enough to have family who helped me out, but I wonder how many other people find themselves struggling to pay such huge vet bills only to find tax is also added. What is the cost to our pets?

attributes.action: Amend s.76 Serious Crime Act 2015 (Parental Alienation amendment)
attributes.background: Parental Alienation is a psychological crime against former partners and children, yet is largely ignored by the Police and Courts. Amend s.76 SCA 2015 to specifically make Parental Alienation a "domestic Abuse" crime. This is child abuse as well as parent abuse and it must stop.
attributes.additional_details: The Courts, CAFCASS, Social Services and the Police treat domestic violence as a crime against women, yet up to 1200 men take their lives each year because the system blocks them from their children. Whilst this may seem like a crime against an adult, it is actually child abuse. Reports in numerous countries demonstrate how damaging this is to children and yet the UK Government ignores the issue. One suicide is too many, but over 1000 annually is a national disgrace.

attributes.action: Allow England to form a devolved Government.
attributes.background: Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales have freedom to make their own decisions and choices with a devolved democracy. England however has to follow the laws that Westminster agrees. It is not fair that these countries get to vote and have an input on decisions that affect our lives but not their own.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g Scotland can contribute to the decision over the future of our NHS, something of which doesn't not affect themselves.
If we had a devolved democracy, England would have the right to freedom. Let our lives be determined by our own decisions and not because of others; with a devolved democracy this is made possible.

attributes.action: Prostate cancer screening tests for men ages 18+
attributes.background:
Men tend to be less likely to check themselves than women.

A screening is less scary and embarrassing for men than visiting their GP.

Women have the tools and aid put in place to help them however men don't... why is that ?
attributes.additional_details:
Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men.

Every 45 minutes one man dies from prostate cancer – that's more than 11,000 men every year

In the UK, about 1 in 8 men will get prostate cancer at some point in their lives.

attributes.action: Not pay foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons
attributes.background: If a country possess nuclear weapons it is in no need of British charity. Donating foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons is a slap in the face of British tax payers.

attributes.action:
Introduce a code on the 'School attendance
Guidance' for chronic illness.
attributes.background: Currently, parents of children who are chronically ill face pressure for their child to improve attendance.  This situation is mainly caused by the absence reporting done as part of inspection.  A code for this type of absence could be reported separately and not impact schools' attendance figures.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of chronically ill children are one of society's most vulnerable groups - they are tired, worried and stressed.  Some have even lost jobs due to their child's health.  

As schools have become more strident in maintaining high attendance levels, pressure to attend has become, in some instances, inhumane.  The current system is not in the best interests of children, of parents or of schools.

A specific code that schools use for chronic health conditions would help to alleviate this issue.

attributes.action: Make politicians in any elections declare if they support Leave or Remain.
attributes.background: In UK elections, voters elect representatives on pledges or party political policies. MP's have broken that trust voting against pledges. We the undersigned petition that: Until further notice, all candidates display 1) Party membership. 2) Their commitment to Remain or Leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Major UK political parties committed to 'Respect the Democratic Leave Referendum Vote in 2016' and were duly returned to parliament by majority in 2017. Since then, we have seen Remain and Leave supporting MP's elected in 'Leave majority seats' vote against previous pledges and even propose obstructions to the process. This has seen party political bickering over the past two years when negotiations and deals should have been the priority. When we vote, we want to know what we are voting for.

attributes.action: Urge Uganda to give MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades a fair trial.
attributes.background: Ugandan MP Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi aka Bobi Wine and his comrades were arrested and allegedly brutally tortured whilst supporting campaigns for an aspiring opposition MP in the northern part of Uganda. We believe this incident is in breach of commonwealth democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: We fear that he has been arrested on false charges, simply for being a successful opposition politician and we are worried he will not be given a fair trial. The UK Government should do all it can to help ensure that Robert Ssetamu Kyagulanyi and his comrades are given a fair trial.

attributes.action: Government: honour your manifesto pledge to plant 11m trees by 2020
attributes.background: You won the election with a promise to plant 11million trees by 2020. You must action this and report bi-annually on progress with measures in place to ensure this is met.
attributes.additional_details: Governments must honour their manifesto pledges. Climate change is upon us and biodiversity loss is unprecedented. This government must be held to account on environmental protection & lack of tangible action on their tree planting pledge. Trees take years to grow, they need a management plan and funds to support their maturation. The Government should deliver their promise on time or provide funding to ensure that a suitable charity can take ownership of this action.

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage for 16 year olds to £5 an hour
attributes.background: Minors work just as well as young adults, so why is there such a large difference between wages? This is unfair because many minors struggle to support themselves and they want to become more independent but cannot because they are constantly relying on their parents to provide them with money.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for minors everywhere.

attributes.action: Consider stronger sentences for burglary offenders
attributes.background:
Currently, the crime levels of burglaries in local areas have increased dramatically.

This may range from physical attacks on residents to completely ransacking a residents house.

Those most likely to reoffend were adults serving prison sentences of less than 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
“Statistics published by the Minstry of Justice (MoJ) reveal that more than 250,000 offences were committed by people with more than 25 previous convictions.

Those most likely to reoffend were adults serving prison sentences of less than 12 months. 

25 per cent of reoffending was due to theft, with more than 10K burglars going on to commit another 2K domestic burglaries within a year.

More than 6K serious violent offenders went on to commit more than 650 violent offences.

attributes.action: Stop convicted criminals being able to change name by Deed poll.
attributes.background: This is very important. Just recently a child killer who served only 3 yrs changed his name by deed poll to hide his criminal past. No background checks are made when applying to change name by deed poll, why?
attributes.additional_details: Background checks on passports, entering Government buildings and new jobs, but we have no background checks on people wanting to change name legally, it can be done within and hour online.

attributes.action:
Close retail stores on Boxing Day. 
Sales will still be sales on the 27th!
attributes.background: In the daily Telegraph Boxing Day was considered “One of Britain’s most Christmassy days for families”. This is not the case for those who work in retail, long hours, little pay, no travel and more importantly VERY LITTLE FAMILY TIME. It really is unnecessary, sale will still be sale on the 27th.

attributes.action: EU nationals paying taxes here, to have a vote in all future GEs and referenda.
attributes.background: There should be no taxation without representation. EU nationals legally resident here for 5 years and paying UK taxes should have a vote in all future GEs and referenda. My Swedish wife, here for 36 years, having brought up 3 children here, working and paying taxes here, still cannot vote in GEs.
attributes.additional_details:
Some 3 million plus EU nationals living and working and paying taxes here in the UK, were denied a voice in the 2016 EU referendum that directly affected them, their families, and their futures here. I believe THAT position is an affront to democracy and makes a mockery of any notion of basic fairness. 

It is an intolerable stain on the reputation of the UK for decency and fairness that this situation exists in 2018.. It must be rectified, and as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Impose time limits for developers upon beginning and finishing construction.
attributes.background: The law should be changed so that Local Planning Authorities must revoke Planning Permission after 18 months if work has not begun. They should also be able to impose financial penalties upon developers who fail to begin construction within 18 months and time limits for completion of projects.
attributes.additional_details: All Local Authorities have a statutory obligation to ensure that they have a 5 year supply of new homes. The efforts of Local Authorities trying to meet their quota is being hampered by developers who do not begin construction once permission is granted. The five year supply is measured by newly completed or dwellings under construction. At present developers are at liberty to submit planning applications on any site if the Local Authority does not have an approved five year housing supply

attributes.action: Stop companies in the Uk selling on debt to third party debt collectors.
attributes.background: 8.3 million people in the uk are in debt that they cannot pay. Debt collection companies are making huge profits from this, by buying debt from companies. These debts should not be allowed to be purchased by third party companies as the debt does not legally belong to the third party.
attributes.additional_details: I would like parliament to look into the law and legislation into third party companies buying debt in the uk.  The debt belongs & sits with the original company. I want the government to make it illegal to purchase debt in the uk and third party companies not to be allowed to chase purchased debt in the uk. Make it law for companies to chase their own debts without contracting another company. To make companies allow people in debt to pay small manageable payments until debt is paid

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Introduce work-based subjects and practical skills into the schools in the UK.
attributes.background: Many children and are choosing to live a life surrounded by the streets, drugs, and murders. This stems from poor education, the education system in the UK is outdated and boring. There needs to be a change to help children, give them confidence and knowledge of work skills.
attributes.additional_details: Why are children still having to learn about the history of the Victorian times and write tons of uninteresting and difficult paperwork, when they could be learning skills of the trade? Maybe they want to be an electrician, which involves mathematical and practical skills. Introducing work-based subjects or practical skills into secondary schools will keep them interested and willing to learn rather than misbehave or drop out of school. An education system they are interested in will give them the knowledge and the confidence to leave secondary education knowing exactly what they are good at, exactly where they want to go after leaving school and are comfortable proceeding a lifelong career and keep them off the streets.

attributes.action: Stop/ reduce the financial requirement in immigration -It's breaking up families
attributes.background: Financial requirements are too high and minimum wage is too low. Lower the financial criteria to minimum wage or get rid of it. Families are being broken by the Home Office as they are deporting genuine family members out of the UK and creating skype families.
attributes.additional_details: You need to earn £18,600 for a spouse visa. When there's a child involved and the member of the family has no working rights, the financial criteria is impossible to reach. It’s destroying lives and making people mentally ill.

attributes.action: we want the uk govement to start a large scale ocean plastic clean up project
attributes.background: plastic in the ocean is detrimental to the health of our oceans, make the uk goverment do something to help this problem

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to give your details if reporting someone to the DWP
attributes.background:
It should be made compulsory to have to give your details when reporting someone to the National Benefit Fraud hotline. 
Name , Address & telephone number should be given at all times . 
Making false accusations against someone is happening constantly & needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Require and fund access for disabled witnesses in all courts.
attributes.background: Disabled people should have access to all courts in the UK which should comply with The Equality Act 2010. Courts have a duty to make these adjustments ,removing barriers restricting the access that prevents people with disabilities being able to attend court, however this isn’t always the case.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have the same rights as able bodied people, and should receive the same level of service. If these measures are not put in place, this should be known as unlawful discrimination. This prevents people with disabilities from continuing with the criminal justice system. This should be implemented for both the witness and the defendant. 
Ramp access through the entire court should be standard. 
I could not access the witness door because it had a step, this led me to, “bump” into my abuser. I had to sit very close to him with a screen but could still hear his breath as I was answering questions.

attributes.action: Require free water bottle refilling stations across UK service stations
attributes.background: The price of bottled water is extortionate in service stations across the UK (in some places beer is cheaper). This means people are penalised for needing an essential fuel of life, and adds to the plastic waste issue epidemic.
attributes.additional_details: Water bottle refilling stations would help cut down our plastic waste, promote a healthier lifestyle, and cut out the unnecessarily high price for bottled water in service stations, all at a low cost to the tax payer. This could be paired with cardboard cups and recycling bins for those wishing to have a quick drink on the go.

attributes.action: Cut the beer tax on our pubs
attributes.background:
The local pub has been the heart and soul of our British culture for many generations and are one of our best assets.  

However, between beer duty, business rates and vat , pubs are under increasing tax pressure . 

We pay nearly 40% of all beer duty in the EU but only drink 12% of the beer.
attributes.additional_details: www.longlivethelocal.pub

attributes.action: Add March 29th to the occasions fireworks are allowed until 1AM
attributes.background: Brexit day must rank at least as high as New Year’s Eve for a celebration.

attributes.action: Establish sepsis as a medical emergency and a priority for the NHS
attributes.background:
The recent surge of sepsis related deaths in the UK, including of my own grandmother, needs to be addressed before more people are lost unnecessarily to the infection. 

Many are dying from sepsis but of these only around 40% of death certificates state sepsis as cause of death.
attributes.additional_details:
Sepsis kills more than 44,000 people a year in the UK alone. This is more than breast, bowel and prostate cancer combined.

Despite these alarming statistics many don’t know about the implications and seriousness of the infection, which leads to an increase in blood pressure and multiple organ failure.

The amount of people with sepsis has increased by over a third from 2015 to 2017, showing this is an ever increasing problem which needs to be addressed as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Government to take ownership of The Tamar Bridge & abolish tolls
attributes.background: The Tamar Bridge between Plymouth & Cornwall forms part of the A38  and is owned by Cornwall Council & Plymouth CC. Just as Severn tolls have been abolished, the current owners are increasing the tolls. This petition asks for the bridge to be central government owned & for the tolls to be abolished.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.tamarcrossings.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=49627

https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/news/plymouth-news/tamar-bridge-torpoint-ferry-toll-2334617

attributes.action: Create a central database of registered electors to prevent fraudulent votes
attributes.background: It’s been alleged that students have been openly abusing the fact that the current law allows them and others to register and to vote in TWO locations. As there is NO central database of registered voters there is little chance of being found out if voting twice.

attributes.action: Permit marriage outdoors without the requirement of a permanent structure
attributes.background: Permit UK citizens to marry under a non-religious legally binding ceremony, in England and Wales, in all outdoor spaces without the requirement of a physical permanent structure. Laws already exist in Scotland and Northern Island. I am calling for equality within all countries of the United Kingdom.

attributes.action:
Universal Credit!
Abolish the waiting time to receive money
attributes.background: The new Universal Credit replaces JSA, Income Support, ESA, Housing Benefit, Tax Credits and Working Tax Credits.
attributes.additional_details:
The rollout of Universal Credit has left many people in poverty. 
Once a person has claimed UC, all their benefits stop until the UC claim has been processed. 
This takes around 5 weeks to process.
We believe the Government should abolish the waiting time for a claimant to receive their money. 
Families face a choice of heating or eating. 
In 21st century Britain this is wrong.
Abolish the 5 week waiting period now!

attributes.action: Keep the A422 through Farthinghoe closed and build a sensible bypass instead.
attributes.background: The recent road closure at Farthinghoe provides the occasion to finally address the problem of heavy traffic passing dangerously through this lovely village.
attributes.additional_details:
Farthinghoe has been in need of a bypass for more than 20 years but the funds and political will have not been available.

Last year there was a consultation and a route chosen.

It isn't sensible to spend money re-opening a road which isn't fit for purpose. Public funds should be spent instead on creating a safe and sustainable solution in the form of a bypass.

The road passes within feet of Farthinghoe village primary school and the children are much safer thanks to the closure.

attributes.action: Call on the Japanese Government to stop their intended return commercial whaling
attributes.background: Japan is standing down from the IWC with the intention of returning to commercial whaling in 2019.  Science shows whales as intelligent with language and culture.  Hunting them for profit is ethically and morally wrong. Their demise damages the planet's ecosystem and thereby our own wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: Human understanding of cetacean intelligence is becoming clearer (https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cetacean_intelligence), as is the role whales play in maintaining life in both coastal and pelagic waters (https://stories.anmm.gov.au/why-save-whales/oceans-nutrient-cycle/). This, in turn, helps maintain the ecosystem that humanity relies on for its own survival.  Climate change is already calling into question human wellbeing. We need all the help we can get to ensure the planet's survival.

attributes.action: In further public vote on course of leaving the EU, "Remain" not an option shown
attributes.background:
In a referendum held too recently the decision was made, many many thousands more than wanting to remain, voted in favour to leave the EU. An further vote should be a progression of this, not regression.

Remain term is ambiguous, rejoining EU now would not mean a status quo.
attributes.additional_details:
Options for voting on should focus on leave directions, for example; current negotiated deal, EEA (Norway) interim deal building to Canada plus, or no deal

Remain term is ambiguous, rejoining EU now would not mean a status quo - increased fee, shared army, joining eurozone, damage to the UK economy would increase in likelihood.

attributes.action: Introduce a “DADB1” form alongside the “MATB1” form.
attributes.background: The "DADB1" form is for expectant fathers to hand to their employer to kickstart discussions about, and preparation for, Shared Parental Leave (SPL). Researchers have indicated that increasing the numbers of men taking SPL is likely to be a lever in closing the UK’s gender pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
SPL was introduced in the UK April 2015. Around 285,000 qualify for SPL every year yet the take-up could be as low as 2% (source: gov.uk). The Government launched a “Share the joy” campaign in February 2018 to promote SPL and increase the uptake. The impact of this is not yet known.

I believe the "DADB1" form is a simple, pragmatic step towards growing the number of men taking SPL by kickstarting early conversations between expectant fathers and their employers.

attributes.action: Make stolen valour the wearing of medals you're not entitled a criminal offence.
attributes.background: There has been several reported cases in the press reciently of people wearing medals they are not entitled to. This should be made a criminal offence for those committing the act.
attributes.additional_details: The United States of America has made this a criminal offence. We should in the U.K. follow suit. People who wear medals they are not entitle to are committing a grave discourtesy to HM Queen Elizabeth.

attributes.action: Increase sentences and enforcement for vandalism within children’s play areas.
attributes.background: Parks and grounds are regularly used to loiter, drink, and cause vandalism nationwide. Our community recently raised an enormous sum to refurbish and improve our local park. Yet each weekend broken bottles and damage is left for the public to clean, putting our children at risk.
attributes.additional_details: Even though there are laws in place to punish litterers, people drinking alcohol, people who cause criminal damage, graffiti and public order offences to name a few, none of these powers seem to prevent the regular damage to our parks. Cameras don’t seem to catch people either. It’s seems to many that these crimes are too minor to warrant higher penalties and I and many others believe harsher punishments and better funding for enforcement is needed to deter this behaviour and protect our children.

attributes.action: Increase the budget for Sussex Police to effectively protect the public
attributes.background: Over the past twenty years, operational police presence in Sussex has been reduced to dangerous levels. A lack of warranted officers is resulting in too many documented cases where there has been a lack of e police response leading to an increased the risk to public safety.
attributes.additional_details: As a former Sussex Police officer who was deployed as a urban and rural unformed officer and Detective, I am deeply concerned that Sussex Police is becoming more isolated and detached from the public it serves. Online referrals are no effective substitute for face to face engagement and the Government and local authority should recognise and react to the severe budgetary restraints that are causing the loss of public confidence in the counties police service.

attributes.action: Add Ukrainians passports as eligible one for Registered Traveller membership
attributes.background: With new low-cost flying directly from Ukraine traveling to the UK number of people who are visiting the UK with Ukrainian passports rise. However, queues at immigration control in airports can be long and take a few hours.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently 2 low-cost airlines started flying from Ukraine directly to the UK, and 1,5 years need for Schengen visa was canceled for Ukrainians. These have made possible to travel from the UK to Ukraine and vice versa even more appealing.

The only thing that is still missing from the equation of perfectness is a possibility to easy and fast pass border when one is arriving in the UK. Queues in the airports at immigration control for non-EU citizens can take up to a few hours. Possibility to have a way to use e-Gates to enter the country will save Ukrainian people numerous hours, especially for those who are traveling to the UK a lot, or who are living in the UK (like me) and like to travel or to the home country or to other destination.

attributes.action: Require that cities allow camping on public property and provide 24 hour toilets
attributes.background: In the UK homeless individuals are often harassed, disturbed and ticketed for temporary encampments on public property. The Vagrancy act 1824 is used to criminalize the very condition of being without a house. Public Space Protection Orders are used by Councils to harass rough sleepers.
attributes.additional_details: Camping is a necessary survival activity for homeless individuals, and must be allowed until all rough sleepers are immediately sheltered. The UK must pass meaningful legislation to insure the homeless have a right to secure their physical well being. We must abolish UK laws or ordinances that prohibit public camping, or criminalise life-sustaining activity. We must also require UK cities with large homeless populations to provide public, 24 hour sanitary facilities such as portable toilets.
